result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D Buerl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Payable from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC).  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.
Court waived costs/fees due to indigency.
-Court set resitution at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Milwaukee county case 19CF922.

superMiscConds.notes: No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

charges.descr: Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard D Buerl

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 07/25/22.fp
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant.  (Richard Buerl - #602930, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Sentencing proceeded. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 30 MONTHS, Consecutive to Milwaukee County Case 19CF922. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 MONTHS.  

Court found Defendant IS  NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS  NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION 
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications. 
- No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

Court set Restitution at ZERO. 

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. 

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.
STATE ORALLY AMENDED "AMENDED COUNT 1"TO REMOVE PENALTY ENHANCER: Mandatory Minimum - Repeat Firearm Crimes, Sec. 939.6195(2)

AS TO COUNT  AMENDED COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  ADDITIONALLY, the State will READ-IN any potential Disorderly Conduct or Recklessly Endangering Safety charges stemming from the earlier events described in the Criminal Complaint that occurred outside 1403 South 59th Street, so that these offenses cannot be charged.  

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Amended Information corrects the address where the offense occurred.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Richard D Buerl not in court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. State did NOT file an Order to Produce. Defendant was not produced, appearance waived. Parties have reached a resolution and have requested a date for Plea/Sentencing. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing in Branch 46. Plea/Sentencing hearing  scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 1:35 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights; received and filed.
-received and filed.
-received and filed.
ADDENDUM TO PLEA QUESTIONAIRE AND WAIVER OF RIGHTS; received and filed.
INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE AND ACKNOWLEDGEMENT; received and filed.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense has not received an Offer Letter. Defense advised the Court of possible resolution. State confirmed and will be sending an Offer and is open to counter offers from Defense.  Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Jury Trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case calendared for final pre-trial. Parties are jointly requesting an adjournment. Case is adjourned in Branch 46.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Witness List
State's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
State's Motion in Limine, filed.
State's Witness List, filed.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court, Defendant Richard D Buerl not in Court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received partial discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Jury Trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Sergio Santa Cruz Medina - West Allis PD. Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior Milwaukee County conviction regarding case #2019CF922. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in Court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Attorney Wineke was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Discussion placed on the record. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS for Preliminary hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Clerk made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom from MSDF.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court, in custody by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard D Buerl not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; doctors appointment. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Case charged by ADA Joshua Mathy. Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case is transferred to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Per an email from Attorney Graber this case is a conflict, she will NOT be appointed. SPD to appoint new counsel.

Defendant Richard D Buerl not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Graber to be appointed in this matter pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with R.O.A. or her children; D.R.H
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard D Buerl in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Richard D Buerl in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard D Buerl appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
